page.title: 01South Lopham Waveney Country
page.content: The fens drain into the Waveney at its source. The remainder of the 791 hectares cover gently undulating land which produces crops mostly sugar beet, also some pigs and sheep. Heavy traffic splits the centre of the village which is a conservation area.The 17th century dwellings are now outnumbered by modern houses, but many are scattered throughout the parish, which boasts only the White Horse Inn and a sub Post Office.Main necessities can still be delivered. For the 374 inhabitants, there is little local work, but no unemployment as jobs are found within a 12 mile radius. Children start school in Norht Lopham and go on to Diss 5 miles away.Hospitals are 20 miles away. local doctors give excellent service. Public Transport is almost non existant.
